comments:
I create some DTP profile connections (I am using JDBC connections to Derby, DB2) successfully.  Frequently, when I restart the workbench, those profiles no longer show up in the Database Explorer view.  I see the following information printed out to the console log.  It looks like an AssertionFailedException is occurring that is related to the problem.  

When this happens, I have to recreate the profiles (all of the old driver information that I entered IS remembered, so I don't have to re-do all of that.    This problem doesn't happen every time that I restart, only some times.  I am not sure what is causing it or how to further diagnose it.

Can you provide some additional information for this one? You mention DB2 and Derby, but do you create any other profiles? I'm just trying to gather more information so I can try to reproduce this. Thanks.

I only have ever created profiles for  Derby 10.1 Embedded and DB2 8.2 databases.

I am trying to reproduce now, but am instead getting the UnsupportedOperationException mentioned in (possibly related?) bug 206691.

Created an attachment (id=80999)
Some fixes when loading profiles from XML file

Hi there... This patch fixes a couple of issues I found while working on some other things. But I don't think it fixes the unsupported operation issue. Still working on that one. --Fitz
